hints.content:
The first bar lines up to $\redD{3}$.   

![A vertical bar graph. Number is on the vertical axis and has lines marking from 0 to 10. Type of Equipment is on the horizontal axis.  There are bars for each of the Types of Equipment. The first bar is 3. The second bar is 5. The third bar is 10. The fourth bar is 1. The first bar is labeled 3 at the top,](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/7a7b31dcbae7dd48eed5c7452540cc5416f64249)

Which type of the equipment has $\redD{3}$ pieces?

Equipment  | Number
:- | :-: 
Jungle gym | $3$ 

There are $\redD{3}$ jungle gyms.  So, the first bar should be labeled $\redD{\text{Jungle gym}}$.
Now let's label the other bars to match the table.

Here is the completed graph:

![A vertical bar graph. Number is on the vertical axis and has lines marking from 0 to 10. Type of Equipment is on the horizontal axis.  There are bars for each of the Types of Equipment. The first bar labeled Jungle Gyms is 3. The second bar labeled Slides is 5. The third bar labeled Swings is 10. The fourth bar labeled Sandbox is 1.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/646ae8ac46f3d24ff99bf6881d508e0ee66b3d0c)

question.content:
Val created a chart and a bar graph to show how many pieces of playground equipment are at the park.

Equipment  | Number
:- | :-: 
Slides | $5$ 
Swings | $10$ 
Sandbox | $1$ 
Jungle gym | $3$ 

**Label each bar on the bar graph.**

[[â˜ƒ label-image 1]]

options.imageAlt: A vertical bar graph. Number is on the vertical axis and has lines marking from 0 to 10. Type of Equipment is on the horizontal axis.  There are bars for each of the Types of Equipment. The first bar is 3. The second bar is 5. The third bar is 10. The fourth bar is 1.
